page.title: 05Landford manor
page.content: Landford Manor is an old building built around fifteen ninety nine. Inside there is oak paneling and it is old too.Today it is used by a firm making maps and plans.The office was built around 1700.An extra wing was added in 1900.The building has been renovated to make it better.The windows are sash ones, and about once every two years the water comes gushing in.The vicar of St.Andrews church was the nephew of Lord Nelson and owned Landford Manor.At the Crystal Palace there was a fire and the fountain was brought back to the manor.There is five and a half acres of land and a pretty garden.The owner of the manor, had the church built next to the manor, so he didnt have to go far to the church.There is a stone tablet just above the manor door.
